info.name: cart-controller
info.description:
# About this collection

This collection helps you set up contract tests to ensure that two separate systems are compatible and can communicate with one another.

## **Using the collection**

**Step 1:** Send the sample requests and view the response and test results.

**Step 2:** Replace the sample request URLs with your desired API endpoints.

**Step 3:** Customize the tests in the "Tests" tab if needed. Don't forget to save your changes.

### Resources

[Scripting in Postman](https://learning.postman.com/docs/writing-scripts/intro-to-scripts/)

[Test script examples](https://learning.postman.com/docs/writing-scripts/script-references/test-examples/)

[Postman Sandbox API reference](https://learning.postman.com/docs/sending-requests/grpc/postman-sandbox-api/#writing-assertions)

[Using the Collection Runner](https://learning.postman.com/docs/collections/running-collections/intro-to-collection-runs/)

[  
](https://postman.postman.co/documentation/24552533-5bead607-0197-4e1d-87d4-3160bc7631c1?entity=&branch=&version=)

request.description: The tests in this request validate that the request body sent as form-data is valid.

**Description**  
This request is designed to test an API endpoint with a small set of query parameters. By sending this request, you can assess how well your API handles simple requests and analyze its response times and performance under a minimal load.

**Request details**  
URL: [https://postman-echo.com/get](https://postman-echo.com/get)  
HTTP Method: GET  
Query Parameters:

- foo1: bar1
- foo2: bar2
    

**Usage**  
To use this request, simply replace the URL with your own API endpoint and modify the query parameters according to your requirements.

item.name: Edit Cart by cartId and productId and quantity

request.description:
This request uses tests to verify both the structure (existence and type of individual properties) and exact values of the response data.

Use `pm.expect(subject)` to wrap test subjects, and [Chai](https://www.chaijs.com/api/bdd/) for assertions.
